text.text:
Outstanding Service and Exceptional Care!

My husband and I would like to extend our heartfelt gratitude and appreciation to the incredible staff at Shift A. Today, we experienced an extraordinary act of kindness and professionalism that left us truly speechless.

In the midst of dealing with waste recycling, my husband accidentally dropped his precious wedding ring into the narrow gap between the skip and the railing. We were both devastated and didn't know what to do. However, the staff at Shift A demonstrated unmatched dedication and went above and beyond to help us in our time of need.

Without hesitation, they swiftly organized a car, and one of their team members skillfully maneuvered it to lift the skip, enabling them to access the small gap where the ring had fallen. Their determination and quick thinking paid off as they successfully retrieved the ring, saving us from what could have been an irreplaceable loss.

We cannot express the depth of our gratitude for their immediate response and remarkable efforts. The level of care and concern they showed us in this situation was truly exceptional. The staff at Shift A not only showcased their professionalism but also exhibited a genuine sense of compassion that is rare to find.

Super amazing service. We are more than grateful.

text.text: I’m only giving a poor review due to the attitude of some of the workers, they really can be quite rude and aggressive when it’s absolutely not necessary. I was there this afternoon when a very reserved Asian man was putting boxes in the cardboard section. A worker noticed that the boxes had polyesterine in them. After shouting at the man in quite an aggressive way, he then walked over and proceeded to humiliate him in front of everyone around very loudly. He even said “Come on, you’re an adult, aren’t you?!” It was very condescending and belittling for someone who made an easy and obviously honest mistake. The worker then walked over to another customer shaking his head and was obviously criticising and mocking the man he had just been talking to. Not to be overly dramatic but I work in mental health and certain encounters such as this can be extremely traumatic and damaging to people. It’s ok to care about your job and make sure things got in the right place but surely there has to be respect for the customers and some professionalism. If a worker gets a kick out of humiliating people, then they shouldn’t be  there.

text.text: A well laid out recycling centre let down by extremely rude, aggressive and confrontational staff. We had spent two days sorting through rubbish after my partners mother had passed away. We had already removed the recyclable items but had several bags remaining of general non-recyclable rubbish. We were yelled at by a staff member who was lounging on a railing. He became argumentative when we headed for the non recycling bay. How do you know they are not recyclable? ( because we'd spent two days sifting through it all) when I tried to explain, he said 'not my problem love, you should have sorted it before you got here'. We left and went to Adswood, who were courtesy itself. They couldn't have been more helpful and we disposed of our non-recyclables without an interrogation. This type of unprofessional and antagonistic attitude is counter productive. It will dissuade people from making the effort to recycle.

text.text:
What an utter joke. I had to drive from Orkney to my folks house in Gatley to help convert a work room into a bedroom for my elderly mother who has just got out of hospital,  my dad's in his eighties and only has a small car. So the obvious thing to do was put the cupboards and wooden bits n bobs in my small campervan.  To do this I simply removed the bed. On arrival I was told I'd need a permit.  But because my vehicle is registered at my home in Orkney and not my elderly parents house in Greater Manchester they said I'd likely not get one anyway because I'm not a Greater Manchester council tax payer, my folks are though and I'm here helping them. So after some discussion I was directed over to the household waste section where a member of staff would decide if my vehicle was a campervan or not. Seems that it isn't. Even though it had a cupboard, toilet, is lined out and has Seitz motorhome windows along the sides. "No that's not a campervan. You couldn't stay in there". "Well not at the moment no because its full of bloody old kitchen units but when the beds in place of course I can and have been for the last ten days"
Little Mr vehicle inspector wasn't moving so I've had to drive back to my folks house and unload it all so I have somewhere to sleep tonight.
So thanks for nothing Sharston tip. You've helped make an already stressful time even worse.

text.text:
Just come back from the tip and the staff member ant entrance was excellent and very friendly.
However, when I went in to donate a table to the shop was told I had to go back to the green corrugated building and put it there.
When I got there I noticed a mirror and a picture that I would like to buy.
Went into the recycle shop for a look around and said I’d like to buy the pic and mirror. The surly lady in the shop (she’s often like that) said I can’t as it has to go back to HQ first.
1) if it’s a recycling centre, why is the system refusing two direct sales?
2) if its planet friendly, why is time, effort and possibly travel and fuel being wasted in taking these items to HQ?
It doesn’t make business or practical sense.
Realise the person is following a process, but the process needs changing surely? Not impressed.

Went a couple of weeks ago with a variety of stuff,the people manning the containers were very helpful and polite. However the lady running the charity shop that day was abrasive and rude. We had over one hundred books for donation, some paperbacks some hardbacks and some medical textbooks all in pristine condition.
The lady would not let us leave them and insisted we put them in an outdoor skip and they would take a look later. In the rain - as if. We took them to a charity shop instead who were very appreciative. That lady needs a customer care course.

text.text:
Never thought I would say this about a tip, but it’s great!
It can be a daunting task doing a tip run, but all the staff have been super helpful and friendly every single time I have been (probably around 10 times now). It honestly makes a difference, thank you to everyone who works there, please keep up the good work!

originalText.text:
Never thought I would say this about a tip, but it’s great!
It can be a daunting task doing a tip run, but all the staff have been super helpful and friendly every single time I have been (probably around 10 times now). It honestly makes a difference, thank you to everyone who works there, please keep up the good work!

text.text: The recycling centre now has dedicated collection points for many more recycling  streams than it originally offered. It also has reuse points on the right as you drive in for furniture, CDs, computer games, laptops, footwear and I think clothing. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable.

text.text:
I would like to say a big ‘Thank you’ to John, Chris, Jamie, Dave, Rob, Glenda, Donald, Rob M and the whole hard working, team at Rosehill Refuse Depot.

For all the years I have been using this tip I have always found the staff to be friendly, polite, and very helpful  - come rain, hail, snow, freezing temperatures! or baking hot!.
The site is spotless and they are always on hand to help and assist me with things I can’t lift /carry or when i’m not sure which container to use.

Clearly they take pride in what they do and this is reflected in everything I’ve mentioned above. They  have even made a beautiful little garden area which is full of bee friendly flowers, grasses and ornaments.  It is so creative and has obviously taken a lot of work which they didn’t need to do. Another special touch which makes this depot a pleasure to visit.
Thank you to all involved with this .... and a special mention to Chris and John in particular who’s care and love for nature and the environment are clearly apparent - such truly commendable qualities to possess.

A fantastic team, thanks to each and everyone of you - you should be very proud of yourselves 😊

10/10 ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

text.text:
It's a great dump. Working 9 till 6 during the Covid Era, well organised and manned, bring your rubbish and recycle. Need help? The crew are more than happy to tell you where to stick your garden waste, in the nicest possible way. Almost.

They'll take clothes ( bagged), TVs, fluorescent tubes, old batteries, dodgy chemicals, and most household recycling. WON'T TAKE PLASTERBOARD, apparently asbestos hazard. Now have the refuse charity shop cabin for re-usable rubbish.
Top tipping.....
